notes:
Total tests are taken from the annotations on the charts on the page. 
Negatives = (Totals – Positives)
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (current date + time = 15:00) site says that cases reported as of 3pm
name: Alaska

notes:
Negatives = (Totals - Positives) 
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (current date + time = 00:00)
name: Alabama

notes:
Data is displayed across two web pages. timestamp provided by primary page, not dashboard. There are two different timestamps on the site: use the later one
[Dashboard](https://adem.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/f533ac8a8b6040e5896b05b47b17a647)
name: Arkansas

notes:
American Samoa has limited official data available.
[3/30 AM Source on Negatives]
(https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/412830/american-samoa-covid-19-test-negative)
name: American Samoa

notes:
Dashboard now has a new tab that details total tested. 
Negative = Total - Positive
Hospital and ICU data [from Maricopa County only](https://www.maricopa.gov/5460/Coronavirus-Disease-2019)
name: Arizona

notes: California continues to show a huge number of pending tests. The state has been inconsistent in its timing of reporting, so we are currently using the [Loma Linda University Health dashboard](https://lluh.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/0a31ad9308574e93b18980acae25f68a) for case counts and deaths, and state numbers for negatives and other outcome data. On 4/2, we will be switching to [California's new dashboards](https://public.tableau.com/views/COVID-19PublicDashboard/Covid-19Public?:embed=y&:display_count=no&:showVizHome=no). We assume that "tests conducted" = "people tested." Time stamp is for the case data from LLHU. Negatives from California state 3/31 update.
name: California

notes:
Negative = People Tested - Cases. Cases include people who test positive for COVID-19 AND people who have symptoms of COVID-19 and are a close contact to someone who tested positive. 
Data is updated daily by about 4 p.m. and includes cases reported through the previous day.
name: Colorado

notes:
Data is being provided in a PDF. 
Negative = Total - Positive.  
Positives occasionally update before totals do; we do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
name: Connecticut

notes: Positive and Negative include both public and commercial labs.
name: District Of Columbia

notes: Last reported negative number is from [3/13 News Report](https://www.delawareonline.com/story/news/local/2020/03/28/delaware-announces-third-covid-19-death-exceeds-200-confirmed-cases/2932377001/).
name: Delaware

notes:
We report all positive and negative tests from FL (residents + non-residents) 
On 3/26 their dashboard stopped including non-residents in its visible counts, but they still track them behind the scenes.  
On 3/21 negatives jumped due to change in methodology: they began including tests of people not investigated as PUIs.
name: Florida

notes:
Positive includes deaths. Positives occasionally update before totals do; we do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
The page includes a "report generated" time at the bottom of the page and a data "as of" time. We use the "as of" time a the top of the page as our Update Time.
name: Georgia

notes:
Counts do not include 4 US sailors who tested positive are in quarantine on a naval base.
[3/31 AM Source - Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GHSOCD/)
name: Guam

notes: Data now pulled from dashboard. Negatives no longer reported. The state [retracted](https://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/2020/03/24/state-officials-report-first-coronavirus-related-death-hawaii/) its first COVID-related death.
name: Hawaii

notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Not all commercial labs report negatives to Iowa, as per their guidance.
name: Iowa

notes: Total includes Oregon residents tested in Idaho, as the state does in its table (noted below).  Negatives = Totals - Positives. Positives sometimes update before totals do; when this happens, we keep the last calculated negative.
name: Idaho

notes: Illinois counts deaths in positives.
name: Illinois

notes: Negative = Total – Positive. Totals are incomplete for private labs, so negatives are a lower bound.
name: Indiana

notes: [Total Hospitalizations](https://khap2.kdhe.state.ks.us/NewsRelease/COVID19/COVID-19_March_30.pdf)
name: Kansas

notes:
Negative = Total - Positive.
Negatives decreased for unknown reasons on 3/20.
name: Kentucky

notes: Total Tests = State Lab + Commercial Lab, Negative = Total Tests - Positive
name: Louisiana

notes: Positives include results from the CDC. Total tested includes repeat testing on individuals. State lab numbers are as of 8 am, other lab numbers are as of 11:30 am. Commercial lab numbers are subject to change.
name: Massachusetts

notes: Didn't report negatives between 3/12 and 3/28.
name: Maryland

notes:
State does not report totals or negatives, last report was: 3/30
Use the time at the top row of the table.
name: Maine

notes: On 3/26, Michigan began reporting "total specimens" tested.
name: Michigan

notes: Since 3/23, Negative = Total - Positive.
name: Minnesota

notes: Negative = Total - Positive
name: Missouri

notes: Mariana Islands.
name: Northern Mariana Islands

notes:
Negatives = Total tested - Positives
Hospitalizations are calculated by calculating multiplying % of hospitalized times total cases, pending clarification from the state.
name: Mississippi

notes: Negative = Total - Positive.  Each data field has its own timestamp, we use the most recent.
name: Montana

notes: Negative = Total tests* - total positives (where total tests include all data from public labs and partial data from hospital and commercial labs).
name: North Carolina

notes: As of 3/30, numbers reflect both public and private lab results.
name: North Dakota

notes:
Pending = Total - Positives - Negatives
If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00
name: Nebraska

notes: Negative count is from the four largest labs. Pending count is from the Public Health Laboratories only.
name: New Hampshire

notes: Positive count includes deaths. Negatives now include all laboratories
name: New Jersey

notes: Hospitalization from [local news reports](https://kfoxtv.com/news/local/new-mexico-state-officials-to-provide-covid-19-update-tuesday-afternoon-03-31-2020)
name: New Mexico

notes: Pending = Totals – Positives – Negatives. Individual data fields have different update times; we use the latest time as our "Last Update" time. NV is one of the rare states to distinguish # of people tested from # of samples tested.
name: Nevada

notes:
Numbers come from [press conference](https://www.governor.ny.gov). 
We are using discharged numbers as recovered
name: New York

notes: Ohio releases total tested as of 3/30 [slide decks](https://coronavirus.ohio.gov/wps/wcm/connect/gov/c831a1c5-1a91-41ba-837d-ddbcba2af6c5/3-30+Presser+Final+%281%29.pdf?MOD=AJPERES&CONVERT_TO=url&CACHEID=ROOTWORKSPACE.Z18_M1HGGIK0N0JO00QO9DDDDM3000-c831a1c5-1a91-41ba-837d-ddbcba2af6c5-n4IWbZu).
name: Ohio

notes: Pending = "PUIs pending results." We exclude "Positive (Out-of-State)" results as we assume these individuals are isolated outside the state. Last Update time based on the "As of" time below the charts.
name: Oklahoma

notes: County level data doesn't add up to the totals provided. We are not adding deaths back into positives.
name: Pennsylvania

notes:
Puerto Rico reports positive, negative, and pending.
One positive was reclassified as a negative on 3/30
name: Puerto Rico

notes: Positive count, deaths, and hospitalized from 3/29 [press conference](https://www.facebook.com/GinaMRaimondo/videos/214205249800791/)
name: Rhode Island

notes: Negatives only from state public health labs. Hospitalization data carried over from weekly 3/25 presentation.
name: South Carolina

notes: Tennessee now provides positive and negative test results from all laboratories.
name: Tennessee

notes: We are assuming Texas is reporting only completed testing, pending further guidance, which we are seeking from the state.
name: Texas

notes: Positive count includes non-Utah residents. Negative = Total - Positive. Negative test results may lag for up to 72 hours, according to the state.
name: Utah

notes: VA hospitalization statistics from [a press conference](https://www.facebook.com/GovernorVA/videos/218402129225741/)
name: Virginia

notes: Virgin Islands: Positive, Negative, and Pending provided.
name: US Virgin Islands

notes:
Negative = (Total Tested - Positives)
Hospitalization number last tracked by Erin Petenko of [VTDigger](VTdigger.com) on 3/27.
name: Vermont

notes: Washington is now tracking cases by date of onset. Data from a new dashboard as of 3/29. Hospitalizations from 3/25 in the [Seattle Times](https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/health/more-than-250-people-in-washington-hospitalized-last-week-with-covid-19-like-symptoms-as-part-of-monthlong-upward-trend-state-data-shows/).

notes: Updates expected at 2 pm CT
name: Wisconsin

notes: Hospitalization reported [by media](https://wchstv.com/news/local/judicial-employee-hospitalized-with-covid-19).

notes: Wyoming's guidance is that commercial labs are only irregularly reporting negatives. Negatives = (Total - Positive) unless this results in a lower number of positives than previously reported
